abstract.para: This document is intended for software developers who are interested in developing applications using the Rackspace Cloud Queues Application Programming Interface (API).

listitem.para: The maximum size of posted messages is now the maximum size of the entire request document, including whitespace, rather than the sum of the individual message "body" field values. On error, the client is now notified of how much it exceeded the limit.
The maximum size of metadata is now the maximum size of the document, including whitespace.

revdescription.para: Updated the Claim Messages description in the Getting Started Guide to show the correct status code (201 Created) in the response example.

Updated the Post Message description in "API Operations" section of the Developer Guide to include the information that you must include even a single message in a JSON array or you will receive the error message "Invalid request body".

listitem.para: Removed the claim_id parameter from the URI for the operation that gets a set of messages by ID from the section "Get Set of Messages by ID" in the Developer Guide.

Updated the instructions for locating the API Key, Tenant ID, and account number in the Cloud Control Panel in section "Retrieving the Authentication Token" in the Getting Started Guide and in the Developer Guide.

preface.title: Preface
preface.para: This document describes new features and changes for the Cloud Queues API.
For detailed information about the Cloud Queues API, see the following documentation at http://docs.rackspace.com/:
Support for Cloud Queues is available 24x7x365 via phone, chat, or you may also File a Ticket.
You can also provide feedback using our feedback forum at Product Feedback Forum.
We welcome your comments, feedback, and bug reports .

chapter.title: Document Change History
chapter.para: This version of the release notes replaces and obsoletes all earlier versions. The most recent changes are described in the table below:

chapter.title: January 22, 2014
chapter.para: This release is includes the following changes for the Cloud Queues API:

listitem.para: The maximum size of posted messages is now the maximum size of the entire request document, including whitespace, rather than the sum of the individual message "body" field values. On error, the client is now notified of by how much the request exceeded the limit.
The maximum size of metadata is now the maximum size of the document, including whitespace.
The documentation was updated to include the following new information based on the code change described above:
In the Cloud Queues Getting Started Guide, the maximum size information was updated in the "Post Message" section.

In the Cloud Queues Developer Guide, the maximum size information for the Data Limits in the "Absolute Limits" section was updated, as were the Set Queue Metadata and Post Message operations descriptions in the "API Operations" section.

chapter.title: January 14, 2014
chapter.para: This release includes the following documentation change for the Cloud Queues API:

listitem.para: In the Cloud Queues Getting Started Guide, the Claim Messages description was updated to correct the status code shown in the response example to 201 (Created).

chapter.title: December 19, 2013
chapter.para: This release includes the following documentation change for the Cloud Queues API:

listitem.para: In the Cloud Queues Developer Guide, the Post Message description in the "API Operations" section was updated to specify that you must include even a single message in a JSON array or you will receive the error message "Invalid request body".

chapter.title: December 12, 2013
chapter.para: This release includes the following documentation changes for the Cloud Queues API:

listitem.para: In the Cloud Queues Developer Guide, the claim_id parameter was removed from the URI for the operation description for "Get Set of Messages by ID".

In the Cloud Queues Getting Started Guide and in the Cloud Queues Developer Guide, the instructions for locating the API Key, Tenant ID, and account number in the Cloud Control Panel were updated in section "Retrieving the Authentication Token".

chapter.title: November 04, 2013
chapter.para: This release is the initial Unlimited Availability (UA) release of the Cloud Queues API.

chapter.title: October 09, 2013
chapter.para: This release is the initial Limited Access (LA) release of the Cloud Queues API.
